5.4.4
Thesaurus Implementations
Finally these data models can be implemented as any of the identiﬁed types on section 2.1, i.e. databases,
XML ﬁles, ﬂat ﬁles, and spreadsheets. A direct implementation would be as tables in a relational database
or in a spreadsheet. Figure 5.4.4 presents a spreadsheet implementation of the record-based model of a
term-based thesaurus, and Figure 5.4.4 presents an XML implementation of the record-based model of a
term-based thesaurus. Both ﬁgures present the same excerpt of the AGROVOC thesaurus represented in
different implementations.
Figure 5.7: Spreadsheet implementation of the record-based
model of a term-based thesaurus
Figure 5.8: XML implementation of the record-based model
of a term-based thesaurus
Figure 5.9 shows how a given type of thesauri can be modeled following one or more data models, each of
which could be implemented in different ways at the implementation layer. As an example, Figure 5.9 shows
a term-based thesaurus modeled following a record-based model. In this case, the thesaurus is implemented
in a database and in an XML ﬁle.
